qas.question: Who started producing comic strips and theories about them in 1827?
What century had comics in wide production?
What 1925 cartoon made speech bubbles popular?
What comics began to dominate in Europe?
When was "The Adventures of Tintin" serialized?
Who started producing comic strips and theories about them in 1872?
What century had comics in local production?
What 1925 cartoon made speech bubbles unpopular?
When was "The Adventures of Tintin" unserialized?

context: The francophone Swiss <a0_0><b5_0>Rodolphe Töpffer<b5_0/><a0_0/> produced comic strips beginning in 1827, and published theories behind the form. Cartoons appeared widely in newspapers and magazines from the <a1_0><b6_0>19th<b6_0/><a1_0/> century. The success of <a2_0><b7_0>Zig et Puce<b7_0/><a2_0/> in 1925 popularized the use of speech balloons in European comics, after which <a3_0>Franco-Belgian<a3_0/> comics began to dominate. The Adventures of Tintin, with its signature clear line style, was first serialized in newspaper comics supplements beginning in <a4_0><b8_0>1929<b8_0/><a4_0/>, and became an icon of Franco-Belgian comics.
